body:
The failure looks like this (example from [log](https://storage.googleapis.com/kubernetes-jenkins/logs/ci-kubernetes-e2e-gci-gce-serial/1150408788860211201/artifacts/bootstrap-e2e-master/kube-master-installation.log)):
```
Jul 14 14:20:37.678490 bootstrap-e2e-master configure.sh[768]: Start loading kube-system docker images
Jul 14 14:20:37.679010 bootstrap-e2e-master configure.sh[768]: Try to load docker image file /home/kubernetes/kube-docker-files/kube-apiserver.tar
Jul 14 14:20:52.931607 bootstrap-e2e-master configure.sh[768]: Loaded image: k8s.gcr.io/kube-apiserver-amd64:v1.16.0-alpha.0.2243_b9615d5bbcd455
Jul 14 14:20:52.960624 bootstrap-e2e-master configure.sh[768]: Try to load docker image file /home/kubernetes/kube-docker-files/kube-controller-manager.tar
Jul 14 14:20:55.002140 bootstrap-e2e-master configure.sh[768]: Loaded image: k8s.gcr.io/kube-controller-manager-amd64:v1.16.0-alpha.0.2243_b9615d5bbcd455
Jul 14 14:20:55.030028 bootstrap-e2e-master configure.sh[768]: Try to load docker image file /home/kubernetes/kube-docker-files/kube-scheduler.tar
Jul 14 14:20:55.838208 bootstrap-e2e-master configure.sh[768]: Loaded image: k8s.gcr.io/kube-scheduler-amd64:v1.16.0-alpha.0.2243_b9615d5bbcd455
Jul 14 14:20:56.031978 bootstrap-e2e-master configure.sh[768]: /home/kubernetes/bin/configure.sh: line 388: local: manifest_name: readonly variable
Jul 14 14:20:56.032791 bootstrap-e2e-master systemd[1]: kube-master-installation.service: Main process exited, code=exited, status=1/FAILURE
Jul 14 14:20:56.034787 bootstrap-e2e-master systemd[1]: Failed to start Download and install k8s binaries and configurations.
Jul 14 14:20:56.034865 bootstrap-e2e-master systemd[1]: kube-master-installation.service: Unit entered failed state.
Jul 14 14:20:56.034910 bootstrap-e2e-master systemd[1]: kube-master-installation.service: Failed with result 'exit-code'.
```

Easy to recreate using the following snippet
```
#!/bin/bash

set -o errexit
set -o nounset
set -o pipefail

function load-docker-images {
	local -r images=("abc-amd64" "xyz-amd44")
	for image in "${images[@]}" ; do
		local -r manifest_name="${image/-amd64/}"
		echo "IMAGE : " $image
		echo "manifest_name :"  $manifest_name
	done
}

load-docker-images
```

```
IMAGE :  abc-amd64
manifest_name : abc
a.sh: line 10: local: manifest_name: readonly variable
```

title: GCE Jobs failing due to latest change in 80054
